sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Charles R. Charles by the grace of God king of Scotland, England, France and Ireland, Defender of the faith. To our lovits ... Whairas we have by many fair and calme waies, and alanerly by them endevoured to reclaime our subjects ... Proclamations, 1639-04-25. Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
3 p.
Imprinted by Robert Young, His Majesties printer for Scotland, [London? : Anno Dom[ini] M.DC.XXXIX [1639]]
Imprint from colophon. Robert Young worked as a printer in London and Oxford in 1639. Cf. Steele 1700 (Scotland). Royal arms 223, with 9 lines of shading between 'HONI' and 'SOIT'.--STC. A revision of STC 22002, also published in London, 1639, and ordered suppressed by King Charles in favor of this proclamation. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

3 p.
Imprinted by Robert Young, His Majesties printer for Scotland, [London? : Anno Dom[ini] M.DC.XXXIX [1639]]
Imprint from colophon. Robert Young worked as a printer in London and Oxford in 1639. Cf. Steele 1700 (Scotland). Royal arms 223, with 9 lines of shading between 'HONI' and 'SOIT'.--STC. A revision of STC 22002, also published in London, 1639, and ordered suppressed by King Charles in favor of this proclamation. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
Scotland
His Majesties printer
Robert Young
